page.title: 03ALL SAINTS CHURCH/EXTERIOR
page.content: The church was built in the thirteenth century,out of stone specially imported from France,knapped flintwork and Roman brick.At the entrance to the churchyard is a fine lych gate.The church was built on a hill for defence where the ancient roads from Alresford and Thorrington meet and continue into the town.It can be seen seventeen miles away at sea.In earlier times the vicar would set a light on top of the tower on stormy nights to warn passing ships.A magnificent view of the surrounding countryside may be seen from the top of the 97ft tower by those fit enough to climb,the 126 steps of the narrow spiral staircase. In 1884 the Essex earthquake actually hurled the pinnacle from the top of the tower through to the nave. The pinnacle now stands in the church.
